p: It is important to keep in mind that viral population isolation and reconnection events can occur at a much smaller time scale within hosts. There is increasing evidence suggesting that genetic compartmentalization of viral populations occurs in different organs, tissues, or cells, and might play a critical role for virus evolution and more importantly for its control. This has been demonstrated for HIV ( Schnell et al. 2011 ; Buz√≥n et al. 2011 ) as well as human cytomegalovirus ( Renzette et al. 2011 , 2013, 2014, 2015). Appling the analytical framework detailed here could provide a powerful tool to dissect the dynamics and genetic composition of virus across different genetic compartments, in addition to those dynamics between hosts.
